title.narrative: #JordanHortiFuture: Towards a More Inclusive and Resilient Horticulture Sector for Smallholder Farmers in Jordan

description.narrative: Mercy Corps in partnership with Wageningen University & Research (WUR), Advance Consulting and Agriterra is implementing the three-year #JordanHortiFuture programme, guided by the overarching goal of enabling smallholder farmers to have an increased income and resilience in a better performing horticulture sector. The Consortium, focusing in Irbid, Ajloun (highlands), and Balqa (Jordan Valley), will adopt an inclusive and layered-approach to address the root causes and challenges of smallholder farmers and value chain actors, both at individual and organization-level, to enhance efficiency, sustainability and profitability of the horticulture sector in Jordan. Ultimately, the programme will contribute to a horticulture sector in Jordan that is inclusive, entrepreneurial, sustainable and resilient for these smallholder farmers. To this end, the programme will target smallholder farmers, but also SMEs and other value chain actors, cooperatives, government agencies, policy makers and financial institutions.

title.narrative: Output 1.2.1: Nature inclusive practices piloted in horticulture sector
Indicator 1.2.1: # of piloted interventions on nature inclusive agriculture

description.narrative: Based on the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO), this indicator will capture the number of pilot projects launched by WUR following their research and technical inputs to to test and further finetune the proposed nature inclusive interventions and strategies, and to evaluate and identify approaches to roll-out and bring these interventions and strategies to scale.

title.narrative: Output 1.1.4: Increased SHFs peer to peer support [olives]
Indicator 1.1.4.b: # of peer-to-peer sessions held per year among olive farmers

description.narrative: From those who received trainings under the project, this indicator captures the number of farmers who attended peer-to-peer groups presented by trained farmers

title.narrative: Output 1.1.1: Increased SHFs knowledge of Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) and farm management
Indicator 1.1.1.a: Number of SHFs trained on GAP

description.narrative: The indicator captures beneficiaries who received GAP training

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.b: % increase in SHFs knowledge of Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) -including farm management-

description.narrative: The indicator captures the knowledge gained during the GAP training provided by the Consortium

title.narrative: Output 1.1.2: Improved farm-level decision making for SHFs
Indicator 1.1.2.a: Number of developed decision making tools (e.g. farm-level data collection and analysis tools) for SHF

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of decision making tools developed, including IPM, mobile applications for record keeping, etc.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.2.b: Number of SHF who reported using farm-level decision making tool

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of smallholder farmers who have used the farm-level decision making tool

title.narrative: Output 3.1.2: Applied research put into practice
Indicator 3.1.2: # of farmers adopting/testing information/techniques from disseminated research

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of farmers adopting and testing new information and techniques which were gained from NARC, as a result of the project support

title.narrative: Output 3.1.3: Analysis services for smallholder horticulture improved
Indicator 3.1.3: # of farmers using analysis services

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of farmers who are benefitting from the newly-introduced analysis services at NARC as a result of project support in upgrading their laboratory facilities and services

title.narrative: Output 3.3.1 Synergies created between initiatives and set up of round tables , platforms

Indicator 3.3.1: # of learning activities created and roundtables set up to improve the horticultursector (Learning agenda, research documents, etc.) linked to field innovation days, PMEL results, results of action research etc.

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of learning activities and roundtables conducted with partners and stakeholders, and dissmentation of research developed under the project

title.narrative: Output 3.1.1: Tailored staff support delivered NARC
Indicator 3.1.1: # of male and female NARC staff who are trained on technical areas

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of staff that the project trains from NARC

title.narrative: Output 1.1.3: Increased financial support for farm improvements
Indicator 1.1.3a: # of grants provided for farm improvements

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of sub-grants (financial support) provided to SHF in the form of assets transfer

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.3b: % of farmers that uptake of new financial products/services
Outcome 3: Improved ecosystem to support and strengthen SHFs
Indicator 3.2: % of stakeholders that report improvement of services for SHFs as a result of coordination

description.narrative: The Indicator captures the percentage increase in the quality of services available for SHFs as a result of various coordinatio efforts including but not limited to coordination between implementers, private sector and NARC, and the project others during applied research (disaggregation should have types of services, types of stakeholders)

title.narrative: Indicator 3.1: % of project participants reporting increased use of timely and accurate information for risk-informed decision making

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage increase in access to agri-business information for project participants / stakeholders as a reult of project support

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 1.1: Improved farm-level practices & management of SHFs
Indicator 1.1.5 : % of smallholder farms that experience increase in participation of target groups in SHF decisions about horticultural practices/crop use (adapted from CIGAR Gender guidance)

description.narrative: The indicator captures the level of participation and decision making around the use of practices and selling prodcuts

comment.narrative: The indicator captures the level of participation and decision making around the use of practices and selling products

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1: % of smallholder farms that experience an increase in horticulture yields

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage increase in horticulture yields for smallholder farmers as a result of project support (GAP and farm management training, ToT training, farm-level decision making tools, etc)

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.6: % of SHF who reported increased water saving since the adoption of water saving technology

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of farmers who self-report that their water saving increased following the adoption of water saving technology introduced by JHF

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.2: % of smallholder farms that demonstrate adoption of new practices in horticulture activities

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of newly acquired skills in horticulture activities as a result of project support

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.4: % of smallholder farms that demonstrate adoption of new businesses skills

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farmers who adopted new business skills as a result of the project support (GAP and farm management training sessions)

comment.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farmers who adopted new business skills as a result of the project support (GAP and farm management training sessions)

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.3: % smallholder farms that introduce new water saving techniques and/or technologies in horticulture activities

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farms that introduced new water saving techniques and/or technologies in their horticulture activities as a result of project support (Farm management improvement grants, GAP trainings)

title.narrative: Outcome 1: Smallholder farmers have adopted improved agricultural practices
Indicator 1.1: % of smallholders who report % income increase from horticulture and agribusiness markets

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage increase in income of smallholder farmers as a result of the project support (GAP training, ToT, development of agricultural tools, etc.)

title.narrative: Indicator 1.5: % of females receiving capacity building activities within the programme (National Women Strategy-adapted)

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of females who benefit from capacity building activities within JHF, including training and sub-grants. This indicator was extracted from the National Women Strategy (2020-2025) and been adapted to fit the requirements of the project.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.4 : % of Male and Female SHF who reported improvement in ecological aspect (water resource management, soil improvements, integrated crop management etc)

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of male and female smallholder farmers who reported improvement in ecological aspect as a result of project support (GAP Training, farm management improvement plan, etc)

title.narrative: Indicator 1.3: % of smallholder farmers who report improved adaptability and ability to withstand shocks

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farmers who feel they have improved ability to withstand external shocks (whether in the market or environment) as a result of project support

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2: % of smallholder (F/M/Youth) farms that report increased productivity of farm activities due to adoption of project provided support

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage productivity increase of smallholder farmers as a result of the project support (GAP training, ToT, development of agricultural tools, etc.)

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 1.2: Nature inclusive practices piloted in horticulture sector
Indicator 1.2.2: % of farmers who take up the Nature inclusive practice, learning from the pilot (adoption of practices)

description.narrative: The indicator captures the % of farmers who adopted nature inclusive practices through pilots developed under this project

comment.narrative: Conduct the initial research and outline the technical inputs needed in line with Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO) on sustainable agriculture and nature-inclusive agriculture Therefore, to assess the knowledge of the festival participant farmers, a survey has been distributed to 140 farmers, the results will be presented in Q2

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.3: Crop yield gap (actual yield as % of attainable yield) - (SDG 2.4 indicator)

description.narrative: The indicator captures the % of farmers who adopted nature inclusive practices through pilots developed under this project

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.1: % of farmers reported improved yields due to nature inclusive pilots

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of improved yield for smallholder farmers as a result of nature inclusive pilots

title.narrative: Indicator 1.2.4: # of hectares of farmland used more eco-friendly (MFA indicator 3.1)

description.narrative: This indicator captures the number of hectares of farmland used more eco-friendly as a result of the nature inclusive practices piloted by JHF support. This indicator is extracted from MFA Results Framework. Target set based on the assumption that within pilots (1.5 hectares) and under sub-grants (50 hectares)

title.narrative: Outcome 2: Horticulture value chain for Smallholder Farmers operating at scale, efficient and inclusive

Indicator 2.1a: % of SHF who reported improvement ( quantity, quality, inclusive, efficient and effective) in supply chain relationship which is also inclusive (Improved delivery and access of services and goods in the value chain, Access to network, Producer capacity)

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of improvement in supply chain relationships for smallholder farmers as a result of the project support (innovation days consisting of value chain actors, Annual Olive Oil Festival, etc)

comment.narrative:
Jordan HortiFuture in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture and many local and international partners facilitated the 21st National Olive Festival & Rural Products Exhibition that was held in the capital Amman, over the course of 10 days and it concluded with 232 tons of olive oil sold. The participants in the festival reached more than (500) participants between farmers, rural women, associations, oil press factories, and field schools, in addition to small companies and several projects that joined the Agricultural Innovation Incubator. 263,458 people visited the festival, and the sales revenue has topped 3 million JOD.
The percentage will be calculated once NARC report is published

title.narrative: Indicator 2.2 : % of smallholder farmers that report an increase in access to new markets

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of increased access to new markets for smallholder farmers as a result of the project support

title.narrative: Indicator 2.1b: % of SHF who applied practiced the value chain activities promoted by the project in the past 12 months

description.narrative: This indicator captures the percentage of adoption of tools, learning, and other areas of implementation that indicate behavior change on the part of the target groups for various activities

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 3.2: The Jordan Cooperative Corporation (JCC) improves performance
Indicator 3.2.1 : % of smallholders and other stakeholders that are satisfied with the quality of services delivered by JCC

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farmers and other stakeholders who reported that they are satisfied with the quality of services delivered by JCC

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 3.1: The National Agricultural Research Center (NARC) improves performance
Indicator 3.1.1b: % of smallholders and other stakeholders that are satisfied with the quality of services delivered by NARC

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farmers and other stakeholders who reported that they are satisfied with the quality of services delivered by NARC (analysis services include soil testing, fertilizer quality, compost nutritional, composition, water quality, etc.)

title.narrative: Indicator 3.1.1a: % of smallholders and other stakeholders that report an increase in the quantity and quality of services delivered by NARC

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of smallholder farmers and other stakeholders who reported that they have experienced or witnessed an improvement in the quality of services delivered by NARC (analysis services include soil testing, fertilizer quality, compost nutritional, composition, water quality, etc.)

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 2.1: Improved markets access and service delivery for SHFs
Indicator 2.1.2: % of smallholder farmers that report to have received better services and goods and/or output markets

description.narrative: This indicator captures the % of SHFs reporting improeved frequency, quality of the agricultural extension services, inputs and goods

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 3.3: Increased engagement, learning and coordination between horticulture sector stakeholders to solve challenges in the horticulture sector
Indicator 3.3.1 : % of Horticulture stakeholders that report increased cooperation to solve challenges and / or provide improvements in the sector

description.narrative: This indicator captures the cooperation and coordination between Horticulture stakeholders to include: Dutch-funded project implementers and others stakeholders including donors present in the country, to solve challenges in the sector

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 2.2: Horticulture cooperatives demonstrate improved business performance and service provision for their members
Indicator 2.2.2: % of cooperative members reported improved services of the cooperatives

description.narrative: The indicator captures the percentage of cooperative members reporting receiving better and improved services

title.narrative: Indicator 2.2.1: % of improvement in cooperative business performance

description.narrative: This indicator captures the level of improvement in the cooperatives supported in the project in terms of business performance

title.narrative: Output 3.2.1: Customized organizational support delivered
Indicator 3.2.1: # of JCC staff trained

description.narrative: This indicator captures the number of JCC staff trained under the project

title.narrative: Output 3.4.1: Supportive action research & applied research conducted
Indicator 3.4.1: # of action & applied research activities with public / private partners

description.narrative: This indicator captures the number of action and applied research developed in partnership with public and/or private sector, including white paper

title.narrative: Output 2.1.2: Service delivery and products for SHFs increased
Indicator 2.1.2b: # of farmers directly benefiting from new product and services

description.narrative: The indicator captures the number of farmers who directly benefited from the cost - effective innovations/technologies services and products

title.narrative: Indicator 2.1.2 a: # of introduced products and/or services to the SHF

description.narrative: This indicator captures the number of pilot products and/or services adopted by farmers that promote cost-effective innovations/technologies. These could include services such as pruning services for tree crops, seedling supply systems, grafting, and IPM services

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 3.4: Increased relevant for SHs action research conducted
Indicator 3.4.1: % of smallerholder farmers who report being satisfied with their involvement in the Action Research/Applied Research

comment.narrative: This indicator captures the involvement and satisfaction of SHF who take part of the Action Research/Applied Research

title.narrative: Output 2.2.1: Institutional capacity of horticulture cooperatives increased
Indicator 2.2.1 b: % of cooperatives that report increased business performance

description.narrative: The indicator captures the improvement in business performance within partner cooperatives following the support of Agriterra

title.narrative: Indicator 2.2.1a: # of cooperative boards members & staff trained
Output 2.1.1: Linkages between value chain and farmers strengthened
Indicator 2.1.1: # of business transactions between market actors and farmers

comment.narrative: "The 21st National Olive Festival & Rural Products Exhibition The actual number will be calculated once NARC report is published"
